title: The ASLE website is an excellent, growing source of theoretical, bibliographic and pedagogical material, with an especially interesting section that includes twelve different definitions of ‘ecocriticism’: <http://www
This would be a good starting point for further research
Beyond Nature Writing: Expanding the Boundaries of Ecocriticism
Examines a wide variety of authors and periods, with a broadly social ecological and ecofeminist perspective
The Song of the Earth
A dialectical reading of canonical literature, mainly British, using Heideggerean concepts

note: Not only a new terrain for ecocriticism, but also a politically progressive theoretical framework.
title: The Nature of Cities: Ecocriticism and Urban Environments
Discordant Harmonies: a New Ecology for the Twenty-First Century
An accessible and thoughtprovoking introduction to recent ecological theory that recognises the importance of tropes

note: Together with Buell’s earlier Thoreau book, constitutes a thorough basis for American ecocriticism.
title: Writing for an Endangered World: Literature, Culture, and Environment in the U.S. and Beyond
Uncommon Ground: Rethinking the Human Place in Nature
An excellent collection of work by writers from a variety of disciplinary backgrounds
The Ecocriticism Reader: Landmarks in Literary Ecology
Canonical anthology with a broadly deep ecological approach and exclusively American focus
Writing the Environment, London: Zed Books. Important anthology containing essays on children’s 186 further reading literature, wildlife programming and Oscar Wilde as well as canonical literature
The Song of the Dodo: Island Biogeography in an Age of Extinctions
Excellent example of popular scientific writing that explains one of our most pressing ecological problems
What is Nature? Oxford: Blackwell. An uniquely accessible and insightful discussion of ecophilosophy and politics
The Green Breast of the New World: Landscape, Gender, and American Fiction
A persuasive ecofeminist reading of canonical American literature
The Culture of Nature: North American Landscape from Disney to the Exxon
A witty and combative contribution to green cultural studies
Desert Solitaire: a Season in the Wilderness
